newsitem.title: IRAN: Iran stock index down 3.9 percent in December.
newsitem.headline: Iran stock index down 3.9 percent in December.

text.p: Tehran Stock Exchange's all share index (TEPIX) ended December at 1,967.32 points, a 3.9 percent drop over the course of the month, the exchange's latest monthly bulletin reported.

Market capitalisation of the 224 companies listed on the market amounted to 29,556 billion rials ($9.9 billion at the official exchange rate) in December, a drop of four percent since the end of November.
Shares worth 249.1 billion rials were traded in 29,207 transactions in the month.
Market officials have attributed the fall to recent issues of some 3.3 billion shares and the appearance of additional investment companies offering shares.

Another reason for the fall was the renewed interest among investors in buying foreign exchange after a six percent rise in the value of the dollar to about 4,800 rials on the black market, Iranian newspapers said.
TEPIX is a market-valued weighted index with its base set at 100 in 1990.
($1 = 3,000 rials at the official exchange rate)
